title: couple 31 dogs left devastated
story: Couple with  dogs left devastated after being forced out their homeSue Bell and Dave Haywood run the UKs only dalmatian sanctuary and have issued an urgent plea for help to find a new home near Lancashire big enough to house their  dogsDave Haywood with some of his dalmatians Image: SWNSByLauren BeavisLottie GibbonsPaige Freshwater:,  Mar |commentsA couple with  dogs have issued a desperate plea for help after being forced out their home.Sue Bell, , and Dave Haywood, , run the UKaposs only dalmatian sanctuary.They treat the rehomed dogs like kids - letting them live inside their converted stable and allowing them on sofas and beds. But they have put out an urgent plea for help to find a new home, close to Lancashire, for their family - as their isolated location has become uninhabitable. DAS Dalmatians is currently based just outside Newton Abbott, Devon - or the middle of nowhere, as they describe it.to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.The property gets flooded every time it rains, and the roads are so bad that emergency services cannot reach it, reports the LiverpoolEcho.Sue said: We live in a stable that is down a bridleway. No one will deliver anything.aposaposA few weeks ago we had an electrical fire, and we were very lucky that Dave and I were awake otherwise who knows what could have happened.aposaposThe couple were forced to stop taking in new dogs last month due to the state of their premises. But they want to keep to continue on their mission to help dalmatians, so they are now appealing for dog-friendly potential landlords to get in touch. The couple currently live in a triple stable, with a kitchen, two bedrooms, a bathroom and a lounge - which is usually filled with dalmatians. And le with a pack of dogs is tough - as it means getting up before sunrise to let the dogs out into their field. Sue said: Biscuit likes to sing to us at .am every morning until one of us gets up and lets him onto our bed. Thankfully heaposs the only one that does that. The dogs donapost live in kennels or cages - instead lounging about on the beds and sofas around their converted stable home.  Dinnertime consists of shovelling out kg of dog biscuits every day, with Sue on hand to make sure every dog gets enough. Sue, a full-time dog mum, said: Le with these dogs is madness - but I wouldnapost have it any other way. You have to be dotty to have so many spotties. Iaposve always loved dogs but I love dalmatians because they are dferent. The first dog the couple helped was a six-month-old puppy who was being sold as part of a drug deal. Sue said: The poor little mite was very skinny, dirty and stunk of smoke. We have been asked to help more and more dogs over the years and have never wanted to stop. The couple rehome the dalmatians that are able to live a normal le after being assessed and rehabilitated but take in the kids that cannot be rehomed. She said: These pups stay with us forever being loved and having the best we can give them. We also help dogs that other rescues say no to. If a dog needs our help, I will do whatever I can do to helpwe have room but sadly at the moment, we can not help dogs that are threatened to be euthanised as we do not have room to keep them separated while being assessed.  The eldest of their dogs are Zakky and Zena, aged  who has been with Sue for two years. The pair are brother and sister whose owner died and left them on their own. Sue said: Zakky has a long bite history and bit Dave on meeting him - which can happen quite often with new problem kids. Zakky took a while to realise he didn’t have to bite anymore and now is one of the family and very loving. Zena now has dementia but still knows how to con her Dad into sharing his food with her. We stopped them from being separated - another rescue was going to split them up but they were  years old, it would have been awful for them to do that so they came here. They need to find a new home soon so they can take more dogs - and ideally, one that is in a more suitable location, more easily accessible for food deliveries and vet visits. Sue said: There are no kennels and as the dogs are free-range, they are very happy and don’t bark. Keeping them in a home environment is much better for their well-being. We live in a stable that is down a bridleway. No one will deliver anything. We are on the side of a valley, so every time it rains it floods us. The roof has holes in it so we are exposed to the elements. In summer it is so dusty - I get such bad chest infections. The road is so narrow and bumpy that emergency services are also unable to reach us. aposaposOn Sunday we had an electrical fire, and we were very lucky that Dave and I were awake otherwise who knows what could have happened.aposapos Sue continued: People donapost realise that the dogs are so quiet because they donapost live in kennels - they donapost make a noise. We have so many wonderful dogs that need our care, a huge mixture of ages - and we donapost want them to live in mud anymore.aposapos Sue and Dave, who run the sanctuary full-time, are ideally after a long term let, within a few hours drive of Morecambe Bay in a rural setting with at least an acre of land and a yard.You can donate to the sanctuary here. Do you have a dog story to sell  Email paige.freshwater@reachplc. title: dozens offer boy 17 kidney
story: Exclusive: Dozens offer boy, , kidney to save his le after familys High Court triumphLast week William Verden, , won a High Court battle for a kidney transplant. And tonight his mother Amy McLellen thanked strangers who have offered to be donorsWilliam Verden suffers from kidney disease Image: PAByJohn Siddle:,  Mar |comments Dozens more people have come forward to try to save right-to-le boy William Verden after his family’s legal triumph. Last week William, , won a High Court battle for a kidney transplant.And tonight his mother Amy McLellen thanked strangers who have offered to be donors. Amy said: “So many people have been touched by William’s story. They can see what a wonderful young man he is. We’ve had lots of people come forward in the hope that they are the crucial donor. “We are so thankful to everyone who has supported us throughout this horrendous ordeal.” As we revealed in November, a rare disease called FSGS has wrecked William’s kidneys. Doctors at Royal Manchester Children’s Hospital ruled out a transplant because of complications – including his autism and ADHD – and recommended palliative care.  But a judge ruled that the young golf fanatic should have a transplant and continue dialysis. Amy, , of Newton, Lancs, added: “I especially want to thank the judge for taking the time to meet William. I feel that played a big part in the decision. “Being a parent of a child with a learning disability shouldn’t mean you have to fight for what is given to other children and adults.  “And just because a doctor is a professional doesn’t mean they are always right. “Parents know their children best.” Children with William’s condition usually live to around  but can get to  after a transplant. title: grieving dad talented footballer 28
story: Grieving dad of talented footballer, , who took own le says I begged him not toSam Jones, , was found by his family in a Greater Manchester cemetery on the evening of July  last year - he was rushed to hospital but sadly died three days laterPopular Wythenshawe Town FC footballer Sam Jones died in July last year Image: Wythenshawe Town FC MEN MEDIAByAdam MaidmentEstel Farell-Roig:,  Mar |commentsAn aposexceptionally talentedapos footballer and teacher was begged not to take his own by le by his family, an inquest heard. Sam Jones, , from Denton, in Tameside, Greater Manchester, was found by his family in a cemetery on the evening of July  and was then rushed to hospital. However, he died three days later.The inquest into Samaposs death heard how he had been in touch with his mother at about pm to say he was planning on taking his own le. Sam refused to tell them where he was, but his family said aposthey knew right awayapos where he would be.The inquest, held at South Manchester Coroner’s Court in Stockport, heard his family knew that he would be at a nearby cemetery where his grandmother was buried and, when Samaposs dad Chris got there, he found his son considering ending his le.Emergency services were also called as Samaposs dad and brother tried to help him, reports the MEN. The heartbroken dad told the coroner: I begged him not to do it. Sam was initially taken to Tameside Hospital, and later referred to the critical care unit at Manchester Royal Infirmary. On July , Sam’s condition continued to deteriorate further and he was sadly pronounced dead on July . Senior coroner Alison Mutch, told Sam’s family: “I have to say how you managed to do all of that under those circumstances says a lot about your commitment to try and do the best for him. I understand it must have been a very dficult situation for everyone.” If you are affected by this story there are many people who would be happy to talk to you: Samaritans If you need to talk and donapost know where to turn to, the Samaritans operate a free helpline open   on  . Alternatively you can email jo@samaritans.org or visit the website to find your local branch. SANEline If you or somebody you know is experiencing a mental health problem, SANElineaposs helpline is open between .pm and .pm every day on   . Mind The mental health charity Mind has resources aimed at helping you cope with and plan for a crisis. Visit their website for details on helplines, how to access crisis services and what to doyouaposre unable to get help yourself. *In an emergency, dial  for urgent help A number of his organs were later successfully donated to others in need, the hearing heard. “It was one of Sam’s wishes so that’s what we chose to do,” Mr Jones told the court. The coroner added: “It’s a tribute to your brevity as a family that even in his darkest hours, you were keen to follow your son’s wishes to ensure his organs were donated to give others le evenhe couldn’t live. Of course, it doesn’t bring him back but I hope it served as a small comfort at a very dficult time of grief.” The court heard how Sam joined Oasis Academy Leesbrook in Oldham in  as a P.E. teacher but also regularly taught science and maths.  The school described him as an ‘exceptional and gted teacher’ who was ‘valued and respected’ by staff, students and their parents. Sam later became an assistant deputy at the academy and had been ‘instrumental’ in developing the school’s culture. Describing his son as a keen footballer, Mr Jones said his family were ‘incredibly proud’ of him. “He had a great love for sport,” he told the court. “He was so competitive - being second was not something he would ever accept. He played semi-pro football and played for a number of local teams including Wythenshawe Town FC. “Up to , he was an excellent goalkeeper. Two or three professional clubs even wanted to sign him as a goalkeeper but unfortunately he had lost a love for it. He wanted glory, he wanted to be scoring goals. “He was the first one in the family to ever go to university. It cost mum and dad a lot of money and he went twice. We were very proud of him.” The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  The inquest heard how there had been nothing in Sam’s medical records to indicate he had expressed any concerns with his mental health or had similar thoughts in the past. “Before this, there had been no inkling that this was going to happen to your son and was completely out of character,” Ms Mutch said. It was out of the blue for someone with such a promising career, Ms Mutch said. No notes were found and nothing suspicious was noted in a toxicology report or police investigation.The coroner said she was unable to rule Sam’s death as suicide as there was no clear evidence to suggest he had fully understood the severity of his actions. His death was therefore ruled as the consequence of self-asphyxiation. Addressing Sam’s family upon making the conclusion, Ms Mutch said: “You obviously loved him very much and wanted to support him as much as possible. You were very close to him and wanted to make sure he had the best and most supportive environment. “That level of support is shown on the day when Sam was found. As a mother, I’m sure that is a conversation that will be impossible to forget. “You absolutely did the right thing straight away and I think it shows just how well you knew your son that you knew he would be at the cemetery.” Ms Mutch added: “I can’t imagine this is something you’re ever going to be able to forget. It sounds asyou did everything you could to stop what happened, but unfortunately, notwithstanding your pleas to him, the damage had already been done. “Those must have been very dark and dficult days for you all.” The Samaritans is available  you need to talk. You can contact them for free by calling  , email jo@samaritans.org or head to the website to find your nearest branch. You matter. Alternatively you can email jo@samaritans.org or visit the website to find your local branch. news uk-news kate-middletons-grovelling-apology-after-"WILLIAM AND KATE ARRIVE IN SOUTH WALESByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Mar |commentsThe Duchess of Cambridge is usually admired the world over for her stylish wardrobe and beautul jewellery.But she once had to issue a grovelling apology after being scolded for her choice of outfit - by a three-year-old fan.It came during a visit to Swansea with Prince William in February  when Kate met Rhian Costello and her young daughter Annabel, who didnapost approve of the duchessaposs clothes as she didnapost look like Cinderella.According to little Annabelaposs mum, she had been very excited to meet a real princess but was left a tad disappointed as Kate wasnapost wearing a Disney-inspired dress.  It forced Kate to apologise for not wearing a pretty dress in a very cute exchange. Instead of a glitzy gown, Kate opted for a Hobbs coat, Zara dress and an eye-catching Beulah London scarf. Rhian explained at the time: My daughter loves fairy tales and Cinderella, and she was really excited to meet a real princess. Kate said aposIaposm really sorry Iaposm not wearing a pretty dress todayapos and Annabel said: aposI thought youaposd look like Cinderellaapos. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up.But Rhian told the Daily Mail that despite not wearing a big Cinderella dress, Annabel was so taken with the Duchess.She added: Annabel was so taken with her, she went up and gave her a huge hug and I was extremely surprised that Kate embraced her in such a way.No doubt Kate has spent time recently putting extra thought into the outfits she plans to take with her on her and Williamaposs Caribbean tour that starts on March . Buckingham Palace confirmed last month that they would be travelling to the Caribbean for a week-long trip to help mark the Queenaposs Platinum Jubilee. The tour starts on Saturday, March  and will take in Belize, Jamaica and The Bahamas before ending on March . Kensington Palace said William and Kate will visit historic Mayan sites and celebrate the rich culture of the Garuna community in Belize, as well as explore the country’s bioersity. In Jamaica, they will meet with the Jamaican Defence Force and celebrate the legacy of Bob Marley and other groundbreaking Jamaican musicians alongside potential stars of the future. In the Bahamas, the Cambridges will visit a number of islands and experience a world-famous junkanoo parade.A Kensington Palace spokeswoman said: “Their Royal Highnesses are very much looking forward to the visit, which will be their first joint official overseas tour since the onset of Covid- in .”Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Kate Middleton, Duchess of CambridgePrince WilliamRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news mum-living-one-uks-most-"Martin Lewis gives three money saving energy bill tipsByConnor Teale:,  Mar |commentsCash-strapped homeowners living in one of the UKaposs aposmost deprivedapos areas have been hit so hard by the rising household, food and fuel bills that some no longer turn their cookers on daily. Brits are being clobbered by rocketing energy bills, rising inflation and hikes to national insurance from April, while itaposs forecasted that the cost of essential foods such as bread, potatoes and pasta is likely to rise by between % and % over the coming months. According to a think-tank, every UK household could soon be £, worse off due to the rising costs.Now, people living in Huddersfield have admitted they are taking drastic measures in order to save money, with one woman even claiming that some families are struggling to feed their children, Yorkshire Live reports. Anne Wilkinson, who was shopping at Leeds Road retail park, said her and her husband, who are both retired, are having to be more cautious about what we use.  We are not travelling as much as we would have done in the past , she said. My son lives over in Manchester and when we want to go and see him it is going to be a lot more expensive. We are not absolutely sure what other things might affect us until we get the bills in - there is some uncertainty. I am not surethings like council tax will go up. Anne added she is in a fortunate position but said her previous work as a foster carer means she knows many families who are struggling. A lot of families have no food in the house or electricity because they dare not turn things on. Some people are struggling to feed their children. It makes you cross because you think to yourself: aposIs it all absolutely necessaryapos   Mrs Greaves, who did not want to give her first name, lives in Springbank Road, which falls within an area recently named the second-most deprived in Huddersfield. The mum admitted that she has started to batch cook in order to minimise the number of times she used her cooker. I started cooking for the next two days when I noticed the prices were going up, she said. That way, I do not have to stand over the cooker again because I have done it all in one day. I will cook on Saturday for that evening and also for Sunday so I am not doing two sets of dishes. Once I have cooked, everything is switched off - thataposs it. Then I only have to use the microwave to warm it up . The mum continued: My central heating is on a timer and I do not have a gas fire. The only thing I use everyday is my washing machine.My house insurance has gone up as well, but it is the gas and electric that is the killer. I think that is what is hitting everyoneaposs pockets. With experts forecasting costs may rise further, Mrs Greaves added that it could result in increased levels of crime in the area. Some people canapost eat, she said. I can see more break-ins this year. Some people do not know how they are going to manage. When winter hits them, I think people will be in even more poverty. Sadia Rana, who has lived in Springbank Crescent for  years, said that her bills had risen for WiFi, gas and electric. I cannot say le is aposnormalapos because I have less savings, she said. I am paying more than normal so it means I canapost spend on other things. I think prices will rise again. My son is always watching the news before bed and there are reports every day that prices are going up. news uk-news prince-charles-plans-slim-down-"Prince Charles and Camilla show their support for UkraineBySam Elliott-GibbsReporter:,  Mar |commentsPrince Charles has had a long-term plan to trim down the monarchy once he takes to the throne and it could serve as a warning after recent high profile problems, a royal expert says.The Firm has, of course, already undergone some major structural changes in the past few years. The Duke and Duchess of Sussex have decided their future is not in the UK, while Prince Andrew is not expected to everto public le.But the enforced alterations donapost begin to scratch the surface of whataposs ahead, some believe.Do you enjoy reading about the royal family for all the best royal news from the Mirror here  Charles has long been prepping for the new era and he has Palace hangers-on firmly in his eye-line. It has long been said that the -year-old plans a major shake-up of the when he becomes head of state - and it could also affect royal residences. It remains to be seen which members of the family will be trimmed but analyst Jonathan Sacerdoti told the Mirrror things are about to become very modern.He said: I think when Charles takes to the throne we will see the emphasis put on those who command absolute respect.  The demands of responsibility and certain behaviours that are needed will be at the forefront - simply, you must be totally reliable. It is well known that Charles wants to stamp his mark and in modern times, donapost be surprised to see changes made. It will be a very handy way to respond to the recent controversies, such as Prince Andrew, as well as Prince Harryaposs attacks on the family. The core will be there, and Prince George will join in time - I think that is clear.  But it’s always been speculated that Charles, when he eventually takes over, will want to slim down the working royals at the heart of the family. It will be about commanding respect. I think he is looking forward to being King. It is not simply a change of personnel thataposs ahead of us. Senior royals are acutely aware of the requirement to prove they are value for money and the weight of this responsibility has weighed heavily on the Prince of Wales.  Opening of Buckingham Palace to the public is one idea that the future king is said to be keen to explore. Thereaposs a sense that he wants a slimmed down monarchy to make sure that everybody is doing their bit and [there are] no so-called hangers-on, royal expert Camilla Tominey said. “It does make the future of the monarchy kind of uncertain. “We’ve had this model that the Queen has been at the head of for all of this time, because she’s obviously been on the throne for nearly seven decades.”“That means by association that you’re going to have fewer royals taking on fewer patronages, and then what does that mean for the charities ” she told The ’s Royal Insight podcast.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Buckingham PalacePrince Charles, Prince of WalesRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news prince-harry-learns-dutch-invictus-"Prince Harry learns Dutch words ahead of Invictus GamesByCatherine WylieKieren WilliamsNews Reporter:,  Mar |comments Prince Harry is brushing up on his Dutch ahead of the Invictus Games next month, hours after news he won’t be attending his grandfather’s memorial service broke.A video posted on social media shows Harry trying to learn the language whilst wearing an entirely orange outfit. The Duke of Sussex was seen getting in the spirit for his trip to The Hague, Netherlands in a few weeksapos time.The video came a day after it was confirmed that Prince Harry would miss his grandfather, the Duke of Edinburgh’s memorial service.On Friday, a spokesperson for the Duke of Edinburgh said Harry will notto the UK from the US to join the Royal Family at the high-profile occasion in Westminster Abbey on March .  He hopes to visit his grandmother the Queen soon, the spokesperson added. Prince Harry is not visiting due to security and safety concerns amid an ongoing court battle with the Home Office. In a video retweeted by the Invictus Games Foundation, Harry appears on a video call learning Dutch from four people. He says: One more time guys, please, you know I need to get this right, and I really want to get it right as well, so how do I say aposGood afternoon, youaposve done a great jobapos in Dutch   He is praised for his attempt at saying the sentence in Dutch, and then asks: And what , anything  I need to know  One of the people helping him says: Can you say stroopwafel  And he replies: Stroopwafel. Love those. Harry asks the people on the call: Do you think Iaposm ready  And he is told: We think youaposre ready.  Speaking in Dutch, Harry says: Thank you. See you soon in The Hague. Prince Harry is told to not forget his hat, at which point he dons an orange hat, orange sunglasses and unzips his jacket to reveal an orange T-shirt and stands up to show off orange trousers. Pointing at the camera, Harry says: Letaposs go. Weaposre ready. The tweet says: Prince Harry, The Duke of Sussex, is getting ready for the Netherlands with some Dutch lessons.  We look forward to giving him a warm welcome in The Hague.As we all prepare for The Games, our thoughts are with Team Ukraine, as well as their friends  family.The Duke of Sussex was inspired to found his Invictus Games after attending the Warrior Games in Colorado in  and seeing how the challenge of competitive sports aided the recovery of injured members of the American forces.  He went on to stage the inaugural games in Londonaposs Olympic Park in , followed by Orlando in , Toronto in  and Sydney in . The Invictus Games will take place in The Hague from April -. news uk-news queen-just--minutes-notice-"Prince Philip and The Queen were adorable says Prince HarryByKieren WilliamsNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsThe Queen was reportedly given just  minutesapos notice of Prince Harry’s announcement that he was not attending his grandfather’s memorial service.Harry released a statement about Prince Phillip’s service, saying he will not be ing to the UK and claimed he would feel unsafe after he lost his personal security following his move to the US with we, Meghan Markle.And senior aides have reportedly revealed Harry did not give the Queen much notice of his decision.They told the Sun Her Majesty was informed of his decision to snub the event a quarter of an hour before his statement came out.Harry’s statement read: “The Duke will not be ing to the UK in late March, but hopes to visit his grandmother as soon as possible.”This came amid a High Court row Prince Harry is waging with with the Home Office after his armed bodyguards were removed. Will you be sad to see Harry miss the memorial  Have your say in the comment section He said he would feel unsafe bringing his two children Archie, two, and Lilibet, nine months, over to the UK. Experts previously claimed Harry would have been given aposadequateapos protection for the March  event in Westminster Abbey, and during his stay in Windsor. Harry had said long ago he felt it was not safe to bring his we or children back to the country. Angela Levin, Harry’s biographer, told the Sun: “He has snubbed the Duke of Edinburgh but really he is snubbing the Queen.”  She said the Queen was still grieving the loss of Philip, her husband of  years, and suggested Harry may well use the same reasoning to avoid attending his grandmotheraposs Platinum Jubilee celebration as well. She went on: “He has got this all wrong. If he comes over for a royal event he gets police protection. What they won’t do is,he goes out with his friends he gets security.” Harry has been back to the UK only twice since leaving for the US in  with we Meghan. He ed for Philip’s funeral last April only days after he told Oprah Winfrey of racist comments made by royal family members about his children, without revealing who he was referring to. Two months later he attended an unveiling of a statue of his mother, Princess Diana, at Kensington Palace.This comes as Buckingham Palace revealed today that the Queen would not be attending the Commonwealth Service on Monday.Instead, Prince Charles will be attending in her place. In a statement the palace said: “The Queen has asked The Prince of Wales to represent Her Majesty at the Commonwealth Service at Westminster Abbey on Monday.” Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up .Even though she is not attending, she is still due to carry on with other planned engagements for next week. This was due to be the -year-oldaposs first in-person public engagement since she was advised to rest by her doctors. Other royals including Camilla, Prince William and Kate Middleton, and Princess Alexandra will all still attend the annual service for the Commonwealth of  nations which the Queen heads.  In a full statement, Buckingham Palace said: After discussing the arrangements with the Royal Household, The Queen has asked The Prince of Wales to represent Her Majesty at the Commonwealth Service at Westminster Abbey on Monday. The Queen will continue with other planned engagements, including in person audiences, in the week ahead. The Queenaposs Commonwealth Day message will be distributed in the usual way. title: royal family picture trooping colour
story: Royal family picture from the Trooping the Colour that we may never see againThe Trooping the Colour has marked a sovereigns birthday since the th century - but it may now be dferentHarry and Meghan with the rest of the royals on the balcony of Buckingham Palace Image: AFP via Getty ImagesByEstel Farell-Roig:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsSince the th century, a sovereignaposs birthday has been celebrated with a big military parade but, after , the Royal Family will never look the same.In early June that year, the Queen and her family gathered to mark her official birthday with Trooping the Colour. The Queenaposs nearest relatives gathered for some marching and saluting and the pictures from that are just another example of the extended house of Windsor gathering to wave to the masses.But it now appears that we may never see that sight again as changes are being considered about who is, and who isnapost, allowed to be part of the iconic tradition.  A new report has claimed that the number of approved guests has been signicantly reduced, leaving a number of big names out of the guest list.Because of the pandemic, Trooping the Colour has been paused for the last two years, with only a few military personnel marching around Windsor Castle to mark the Queenaposs birthday. But with Her Majestyaposs Platinum Jubilee celebrations fast approaching, this year will see a spectacularin a four-day long weekend in early June. For months now, people have been wondering whether Harry and Meghan will be there. It has been two years since she visited the UK while Harry has only ed for brief visits and his grandfatheraposs funeral, among others.It is now being reported by the DailyBeast that only those in the direct line of succession will be invited to the Buckingham Palace balcony.Just this week, Prince Harry pulled out of flying over for the Prince Philip memorial amid security concerns. It comes amid the Duke of Sussexaposs legal case against the Home Office over his security arrangements in the UK.Westminster Abbey is hosting a Service of Thanksgiving for the Duke of Edinburgh on March  to commemorate his relationship with the Abbey. title: single mum without hot water
story: Single mum without hot water and sleeping on floor at times wants to ‘take her le’Rosemarie and her two sons claim to have had many problems at their Peabody housing association property in Muswell Hill, north LondonRosemarie says she has been forced to live without hot water and sleep on the floor of her flat Image: MyLondon WSBySylvie WilkinsonEstel Farell-Roig:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsA mum has said the horric conditions at her flat make her want to take her own le at times. Rosemarie, who asked for her surname to not be shared, moved into her flat in North London just over two years ago now and, within  days, the family had a heavy leak coming down through her kitchen ceiling.However, that was only the beginning of the issues the family was to experience at the Peabody housing association property in Muswell Hill, reports MyLondon. The single mum has also been having problems with the boiler, being left without hot water, and Rosemarie said her kids - aged seven and  - constantly complain about the water being too cold.Peabody housing association has apologised for the issues and says it is working to tackle the issues.  But in the meantime, Rosemarie claims things took a dramatic turn for the worse at the beginning of the year when her sonsapos bedroom was hit by flood damage. She said the damage resulted in them sleeping her in and the mum being forced to sleep on the floor. Rosemarie said: “First, the bathroom radiator wasn’t working. They came and they tried to fix it, but it still just comes on now and again. “The radiator in the kids’ bedroom is constantly leaking as well. With the hot water, when you put your hand under it, it’s warm. But seconds later when you put it on your body, it’s cold.The mum-of-two said the lack of hot water in the property has led to huge issues for the family and her sons struggle to wash properly before going to school. She said it’s extremely upsetting and her kids constantly complain about the water being too cold. Rosemarie also claimed the heating in her North London flat does not work properly. This is a huge issue, as she claims the back door to the property hasn’t been sealed properly, meaning the flat gets cold very quickly.  She added: “There’s such a big gap around it - they tried to patch it up but it didn’t work. I’ve got slugs coming through the gap. According to Rosemarie, the conditions in her flat took a dramatic turn on January , earlier this year when her sons’ bedroom was hit by devastating flood damage. Rosemarie explained that the flood damage “mashed up” everything in the room, including the childrenaposs beds, lights and their possessions.As a result, her two sons have been living without beds ever since and she has given them her bed to sleep in. Now, she has been forced to sleep on the floor. “I had to give up my bed - that room is completely out of use,” Rosemarie said. Rosemarie is a vulnerable tenant, with a long history of depression, anxiety and OCD.  She does not feel Peabody is taking her mental health considerations into account and said her living conditions have pushed her to a new low. Tearfully, Rosemarie said: “It’s long term, but since I moved to that property it’s been really bad. I’ve got days when I want to commit suicide. “As soon as I get home, there are days when I’ve wanted to take my own le.” The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  Originally from Jamaica, Rosemarie has no family in the UK she can turn to for help. She said she has worked hard to make her home comfortable to live in, though the constant state of disrepair has made it almost impossible to go on living there. Rosemarie added: “I don’t want to move out, but with the conditions, I have to move. A spokesperson from the Peabody housing association said: We are very sorry about the ongoing issues with [Rosemarie’s] home and understand her concerns, which we’re trying to resolve. Our surveyor and repairs contractor visited the property again yesterday to carry out a full inspection and we will be starting a programme of work straight away to fix these issues. Our local team will also be contacting [Rosemarie] to provide any extra support she needs. We are aware of the leak and hot water issues affecting the property and are working to get this resolved as quickly as possible.We’re committed to proactively tackling problems like this and investing in people’s homes for the long term. title: teacher accused dragging terrified special
story: Teacher accused of dragging terried special needs pupil across classroom by her legRachel Wadsworth, who teachers at Carstairs Junction Primary, faces being struck off after issues in her class of four and five year oldsRachel Wadsworth faces being struck off Image: Google MapsByKelly-Ann MillsNews ReporterRuaraidh Gilmour:,  Mar  A teacher has been accused of dragging a special needs pupil with special needs across a classroom floor by her leg, leaving a fellow staff member in tears.Rachel Wadsworth faces being struck off amid claims she pulled a four or five-year-old girl with a mental age of a toddler by the wrist at Carstairs Junction Primary in Lanarkshire.It is further alleged she hauled the same non-verbal child by the leg back into her classroom on a separate occasion and made her sit on a seat where she had urinated. Miss Wadsworth appeared before the General Teaching Council for Scotlandyesterday to face the claims, Glasgow Live reports. Support teacher Pamela Dougall gave evidence to the , and said she was left in tears after witnessing on the incidents. She said: I witnessed Miss Wadsworth dragging Pupil A back along the floor back to the classroom. Her [Pupil A] tummy was on the floor, she looked terried. I put my hands on my head and said aposyou canapost do thatapos. I asked Pupil Ashe was alright, she put her thumbs up as she is a non-verbal child. Pupil A has a mental age of roughly  to  months. I was in a state of shock, every time I saw Pupil A that day I cried.  She said: The working relationship with Miss Wadsworth was dficult. I got the feeling that she did not want anyone in the class. When I was working with Miss Wadsworth I felt I couldnapost do my job properly as she didnapost trust me. Another support teacher, Jacqueline Steele who was working in a class nearby, told the hearing : I was sitting at a table helping kids finish their work they hadnapost finished and I was looking directly out of the classroom door. I saw Pupil A running past the door.Pupil A stopped at the double doors [ fire exit].Mrs Wadsworth ran up and grabbed Pupil Aaposs arm in quite a forceful manner. Her tugging knocked Pupil A off her balance and she was walking too fast for her to keep up. I put my hands on my head. It was the first time I saw her look frightened. [When Mrs Steele entered Pupil Aaposs classroom] Pupil A was on the floor at the door, it was quite manic and Miss Wadsworth did not have any control of the class. For me it was a child protection issue. That afternoon Pupil A was not herself and was not smiling. You could seeshe looked sad, I was able to tell when she wasnapost happy. Further allegations have been lodged against the teacher such as grabbing the same pupil by the arm and pushing her back onto a chair. Miss Wadsworth also faces allegations that she grabbed another pupil by the shoulders which caused them distress. She has also been accused of leaving the pupils in her additional support needs class unattended. The hearing continues.Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON EducationSchoolsTeachers" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: tributes paid selfless mum who
story: Tributes paid to selfless mum who went to sleep on Christmas Day and never woke upLynn Siner died aged  surrounded by her family on December ,  following a brave battle with cancer, despite being told she had days to live in October that yearLynn Siner with her daughter Ashleigh Image: Marie Curie Ashleigh Siner WSByOlivia WilliamsSam TrueloveNews reporter:,  Mar |commentsA brave mum who went to sleep on Christmas Day and never woke up has been described as someone who was always thinking of others before herself. Lynn Siner died aged  at her home on Boxing Day in  after a battle with cancer.The mum, from Huyton, Merseyside was told she had days to live in the October of that year but her daughter Ashleigh believes her mum was determined to spend one last Christmas with the family, reports Liverpool Echo.Lynn had been in Marie Curie Hospice in the weeks leading up to December , , but was allowed home on Christmas Eve to spend the festive period with her family. Ashleigh said it was a special time for her family and her mum also absolutely loved it. She said: My mum was always thinking of others before herself even though she was so ill, and she wanted to try and make Christmas as normal as possible. It was our tradition every year for myself, my mum and my brother to go to London at the beginning of December for the weekend.  My mum loved to go to Harrods and get her special presents from there. Obviously, she was too ill to go but she still wanted me to go and get everyone’s Christmas presents - she was ringing me from her bed at Marie Curie telling me what to buy from Harrods. “While she was staying at Marie Curie, we brought one of her Christmas trees in from home and decorated it and put all the presents we had bought underneath – we wanted her room to feel very homely. “Christmas was such a special time for our family as my mum absolutely loved it and looked forward to it all year. We enjoyed the build-up, doing Christmassy things and visiting the markets. Mum was too ill to go out to the Christmas markets, but Marie Curie had a special Christmas fayre in the hospice with stalls selling all types of things. All my family went along, and we really enjoyed it. It was perfect as it was all indoors, and we could easily push my mum in the wheelchair from her room and into the lt upstairs to visit the stalls.” Ashleigh added that her mum was allowed home on Christmas Eve, which meant the family could spend the night with eachother. We all stayed with mum on Christmas Eve and we opened our presents as normal on Christmas morning, Ashleigh said. After our Christmas lunch, my mum then fell asleep early afternoon and never really woke again apart from saying the odd sentences, and then she then passed away Boxing Day morning. I really do believe she got the strength to make sure she was there for the whole of Christmas Day. We were told in October that she only had days left to live but she fought on and I think once she was home, and saw us all together for one last Christmas, she was ready to go. Even though it was the worst time of our lives, we are so glad we got to spend that last Christmas together, and Marie Curie helped make that possible.” Lynn was a health care assistant at Alder Hey Childrenaposs Hospital and Ashleigh said due to this she trusted the doctors and nurses at Marie Curie and felt safe and secure at the hospice. Since Lynnaposs death, the family have raised raised thousands of pounds for Marie Curie. Ashleigh said: “At the funeral, we asked for donations to Marie Curie rather than flowers and after that, I thought that I’d like to do other things to raise money for the charity to give something back and do something for my mum and the whole family. “So, the first thing that we did was host charity night at a local social club with raffles, Irish Bingo and entertainment. We did a tombola too and got lots of prizes from dferent companies to auction for the raffle - it was amazing. We raised roughly £, from that event. “Then, when we took the money to Marie Curie and learnt about the Pay for a Day fundraising challenge where we could set ourselves the goal of raising enough money to pay to run the hospice for a whole day. So, we jumped at this and got on with planning our next event a charity walk. “It ended up being a fancy dress walk for family and friends mainly, starting at the Albert Dock and ending up at my mum’s house in Dovecot, where we had drinks to celebrate and toast mum. We walked over K and raised more than £,.” “We plan on doing more fundraising for Marie Curie in the future too.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON ChristmasBoxing DayHarrods Inc.Love IslandCharitiesFuneralsHospitalsStock marketFancy dressChristmas treesChristmas partyCancer" data-immediate"data-immediate"Join the Secret Elves for celebration inspiration - and brilliant gt ideas and reviewsSpread the cheer!Invalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: uk weather forecast ferocious 70mph
story: UK weather forecast: Ferocious mph winds and rain to batter country this weekendThe Met Office has issued yellow warnings for wind this weekend with ferocious gusts and rain expected to batter the country before the sun arrives with C temperaturesPeople are being warned over strong winds this weekend Image: PA Archive PA ImagesByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Mar |commentsBrits are being warned of a blustery weekend with ferocious winds and rain driving into the South West and then spreading across the country on Sunday.The Met Office has issued yellow warnings for wind and rain on both Saturday and Sunday with an unsettled picture ahead before a much improved outlook for next week with sun and temperatures rising as high as C.But for the weekend there is likely to be a battering from the strong winds and plenty of rain.The Met Office weather warning covers the South West on Saturday and runs from pm until pm.It states: “A spell of windy and wet weather during Saturday afternoon may lead to some travel disruption.”  It says: “Some delays to road, rail, air and ferry transport are likely. Probably some bus and train services affected, with some journeys taking longer. “Delays for high-sided vehicles on exposed routes and bridges likely and damage to trees possible. Some short term loss of power and other services is possible. It’s likely that some coastal routes, sea fronts and coastal communities will be affected by spray and or large waves.” Then more widespread yellow warnings are also in place for Sunday with similar advice to expect travel disruption. BBC weather forecaster Tomasz Schafernaker warned people that as well as the strong wind people will need their umbrellas.“A lot of cloud and some rain across Scotland, parts of northern England, brighter across the rest of England and Wales, and in fact some decent sunny spells through the middle of the afternoon and I think the best of the weather will be the further east you go, he said, looking at Saturday.  But notice this curl of rain here, this is a low pressure that is swinging into the south west of the UK. Not only rain but some very strong winds, we are talking of gusts of mph, mph and maybe even mph so it is really going to be quite stormy around some of the coasts.” Mr Schafernaker said it is not widespread but advised people in the South West to take care. Then on Sunday the strong winds will cover the country with the weather impacted by a low pressure system by the west of Scotland. Very gusty winds right across the country, we are talking mph, mph or maybe mph around some exposed coasts … on Sunday it will be blustery right across the UK. Temperatures on Sunday typically between C and C so not as mild as it has been but mild enough, said Mr Schafernaker.  Looking ahead to next week and people can expect spring-like temperatures especially in the south. Monday a much better day, the winds will be lighter there will be some sunshine around, still some showers around northern parts of the country but in the south it really is an improving picture and that’s how it is going to be over the next few days into next week, said Mr Schafernaker. In fact in the south of the country temperatures could peak around C or C. So a mixed weekend but better the week ahead.” UK forecast for the next  days Turning wet and windy in the Southwest this afternoon. Today: Sunny spells and showers this morning, with parts of Scotland seeing some more persistent rain. Showers fading for many this afternoon when wet and windy weather with heavy rain coastal gales develops over southwest England and southwest Wales. Tonight: Early evening rain in the southwest moves slowly northeastwards to extend from western Scotland into northwest England, the Midlands and southern England by dawn. Windy, with gales in the west. Sunday: Early rain over parts of Scotland and England clears eastwards, clearing the far east late afternoon. Otherwise, sunny spells and showers. Windy with coastal gales in the north and west. Outlook for Monday to Wednesday: Occasionally unsettled across northern and western areas, with spells of rain and strong winds. Generally drier where, with some mist and fog overnight, before some rain develops Wednesday. news uk-news vladimir-putins-odd-way-asking-"Vladimir Putin and we Lyudmila on state visit in ByRosaleen FentonDeputy Features Editor:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar Vladimir Putin has launched a devastating attack on Ukraine, in a bid to overthrow its democratically elected government. The odd, reclusive President has an intense daily schedule - and tries to keep intrusions into his personal le strictly limited.Putin married Lyudmila Shkrebneva in  and the couple had two daughters, Mariya and Yekaterina. Although he is notoriously secretive about his personal le, the couple announced their separation in a staged television interview in June . The orce was later confirmed by Lyudmilaaposs name being removed from Putinaposs official biography on the Kremlin website, so his biography simply mentions their children instead. In his  biography aposFirst Personapos, which contains a series of interviews with the Russian president and figures close to him, Lyudmila shared details of their relationship. In a frank chat, she revealed that she didnapost think much of the poorly dressed man she met outside a theatre while on a double date.Follow all todayaposs latest updates on the conflict with our live blog But the pair continued to keep in touch after Putin gave her his phone number - a rare move for the privacy-obsessed KGB officer. After three-and-a-half years, Putin proposed, but his subdued manner left Lyudmila convinced he was actually trying to dump her. She took the interviewee: One night we were sitting this house and he said, You know what kind of person I am by now. In general, Iaposm not very easygoing. He was being self-critical. He explained that he was the silent type that he was rather abrupt in some things and he could even insult people, and so on. He was saying that he was a risky le partner. And he added: In three and a half years, you have probably made up your mind. It sounded to me like we were breaking up. aposYes, Iaposve made up my mind,apos I said. He let out a doubtful aposYes apos Then I was sure that that was it, we were breaking up. But then he said, aposWell thenthat is the way it is, I love you and propose we get married.apos So it all came as a complete surprise to me. title: woman 80 becomes uks longest
story: Woman, , becomes UKs longest-serving female blood donor after giving  pintsChristine Newnham, , has saved many lives and never missed an appointment with her blood bank. The retired nurse has donated three times a year since the age of Christine Newnham has given blood  times over  years Image: SWNSByChloe OConnorMartin BagotHealth and Science editor:,  Mar |comments A great-grandmother is thought to have become the UK’s longest-serving female blood donor after giving  pints over  years.Christine Newnham, , has saved many lives and never missed an appointment with her blood bank. The retired nurse has donated three times a year since the age of . She said: “I was a nurse so needles never bothered me. I was happy to give blood. It made me really happy as I want to save lives. “It’s very simple to do and it doesn’t take up much of your time. I’ve also met so many people at the donor centre, I have so many friends there now I can’t keep up.” The NHS is , blood donors short of what it needs to recover from Covid, having relied on its smallest pool of donors in the st century during the pandemic.We are calling on readers to become a Mirror Blood Hero and register to become a donor. Christine, of Sittingbourne, Kent has seen the benefits of giving blood after a handful of close family members fell ill. She said: “When my daughter-in-law’s dad became sick with a rare type of leukaemia, he needed lots of transfusions. “He was given more time with us all and it was all down to blood donations, it’s an amazing thing. “I had two women approach me in the blood bank who thanked me for saving their lives. “I tried to explain it could have been anyone’s blood, but they just kept thanking me. It makes me cry every time I think about it.” Register as a donor and play your part in the NHS recovery.Visit www.blood or call     to register.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON NHSLeukaemiaDaily Mirror,callToAction:ltpgtGet weekly highlights from Mirror editor Alison Phillips direct to your emaillt pgt,buttonText:,contentId:,newsletterImage:https:i-prod.mirror article.ece ALTERNATES sd _AlisonHeaderFinal.png,endpointUrl:https:response.pure interface list.php,profile:Reach_Mirror,isPureNewsLetter:true,pureMailingListId:Mirror - Alisons Newsletter,isDoubleOptIn:,newsletterSiteName:Mirror" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get weekly highlights from Mirror editor Alison Phillips direct to your emailInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news us-news meghan-markle-prince-harry-slam-"Meghan Markle and Prince Harry speak at Global Citizen LiveByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Mar |commentsPrince Harry and Meghan Markle are among those who have slammed the UK and other countries for not lting intellectual property rules when it comes to the Covid- vaccine.The couple are among  signatories of an open letter that says self-defeating nationalism, pharmaceutical monopolies and inequality stand in our way of ending the pandemic. The letter, which was published today, says the pandemic is not over and that the approach to vaccine equity is immoral, entirely self-defeating and also an ethical, economic and epidemiological failure.It says: The European Union, the United Kingdom, and Switzerland continue to block the lting of intellectual property rules which would enable the redistribution and scale-up of Covid- vaccines, test and treatment manufacturing in the global south. The transfer of largely publicly funded vaccine technology and know-how from pharmaceutical corporations would fast track production to a matter of months. Yet still today, a handful of these corporations retain the power to dictate vaccine supply, distribution and price – and the power to decide who lives and who dies. World leaders, and particularly rich nations, have the responsibility to change this situation and ensure the publicly funded vaccine technology and know-how is available to the global south. The letter, which comes on the second anniversary of Covid- being declared a pandemic, is also signed by actress Charlize Theron, former UK Prime Minister Gordon Brown and former Secretary-General of the United Nations Ban Ki-moon.Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up . Meanwhile, it was also revealed today that the coupleaposs Archewell Foundation has pledged its support to The Peopleaposs Vaccine Alliance - a non-profit organisation that wants everybody across the world to have access to Covid vaccine, tests and treatments. Itaposs unknown how much they have invested. Their investment in the campaign was announced today on The Peopleaposs Vaccine Alliance Twitter page, which said it was proud to welcome Meghan and Harryaposs support.The tweet said: We are proud to welcome Archewell Foundation to the Alliance and appreciate their support, alongside Prince Harry and Meghan, The Duke and Duchess of Sussex.We will work together to end vaccine inequity and ensure COVID- vaccines, treatments and tests are available to everyone.Both Harry and Meghan have spoken out about vaccine equity in the past and last May, Harry made an appearance at Vax Live - a concert in Calornia to promote the sharing of vaccines.The couple has also previously written an open letter to the chief executives of pharmaceutical companies like Pfizer, Moderna and AstraZeneca urging them to redouble their support for the UN-sponsored Covax vaccine equity programme.And last September, during a mini-tour in New York City, the couple appeared at the at Global Citizen Live event in Central Park. During the event, Meghan said: “Every single person on this planet has a fundamental right to get this vaccine but thataposs not happening. “It is wrong that so much of the vaccine supply has only gone to just ten wealthy nations and not everyone , itaposs just not OK.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Meghan MarklePrince HarryRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news weird-news balding-man-tears-new-hair-"Balding man in tears after age defying hair transformationBySofie JacksonVideo News ReporterEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Mar |comments A man who had begun losing his hair has been left crying tears of joy after receiving a hair piece which makes him look  years younger.Ashley Tawney couldnapost keep his emotions to himself as he was filmed breaking down in tears after being fitted with the realistic hair system by Novo Cabelo Hair.The company filmed -view before and after shots on TikTok, leaving followers gobsmacked by Ashleyaposs incredible transformation, the Daily Star reports.In the clip, the voice over can be heard saying: He is tired of feeling self-conscious about his hair.Ashleyaposs eyes are covered so he canapost see stylist Rob working on the hair system, first shaving off unwanted hair, then covering his scalp with protector and adhesive. Rob then fits the hair system and begins styling it so it flows seamlessly into Ashleyaposs natural hair. All we needed was Ashleyaposs reaction – letaposs see what he thinks, the voice over says, as Ashley breaks down in tears, saying, Oh my god! He then examines his new hairstyle from every angle and looks like he is welling up with tears. The video was watched more than , times since it was uploaded on March , by @novocabelohair on TikTok and viewers were just as stunned.Tears in my eyes. People donapost realise this can really shatter some menaposs confidence. It doesnapost define you, but itaposs dficult to accept, one viewer said, while another added: Omg he looks  years younger! I think itaposs great that men can feel better... like women have been with wigs for years, a third wrote, while a fourth commented: What a genuine guy, I’m happy for him he looks amazing. Another TikTok user wrote: I’m a woman who unfortunately is going through my two-stage of hair loss in four years, it’s so upsetting, Ashley you look amazing. Ashley replied to the comments himself, writing: Iaposm so pleased with my new system! I love it! I honestly canapost thank you enough rob, makes me teary watching this! Selfie-taking non-stop. For most men, balding is a totally normal part of getting older butit seems unusual or is affecting your self-esteem you should speak to your GP.The NHS says male pattern hair loss can be treated with finasteride and minoxidil but they do not work for all men and can be expensive, as they are not available on prescription. Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: gp receptionist shares rude things
story: GP receptionist shares rude things all callers say - and theyre very repetitiveA GP receptionist has spoken out about her job, saying what its like dealing with people day in day out who all say the same thing and get annoyed at her for doing her jobThe receptionist said they were asked the same questions all day long Image: Getty ImagesByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Mar |comments A GP receptionist has revealed the rude and annoying things patients say when they call up - and theyaposre so common you might be guilty of them without realising.Weaposve all been there, on hold when you call up bang on the minute the surgery opens - ashundreds of people managed to beat you to it in the seconds it took your phone to connect. When you get through, you might be tempted to say how long youaposve been on hold, or ask how many people are answering the phones, but spare a thought for the poor receptionist. Sharing the story anonymously, the receptionist said that they get asked those questions constantly, and while the caller utters the words the hold queue continues to grow. What do you think about the call queues  Let us know in the comments...Sharing their story anonymously, the receptionist said the first question they dread is: God is there only one of you answering the phone  To which the woman replies: No there are around seven of us and we arenapost just sat around drinking tea. Another classic the receptionist shared was when people say: Finally, Iaposve been on hold for two hours. But she said: We can see how long youaposve been on hold and itaposs not two hours.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. She also said that people get frustrated when they canapost speak to their GP immediately. The woman explained that some say: Why canapost you just put me through to the doctor  To which she replied: There are about  patients always waiting for a call back.She also said that some people tell her youaposre just a receptionist I want to speak to someone who knows what they are talking about, as The Sun reports. title: influencer debunks how perfect bikini
story: Influencer debunks how perfect bikini snaps are taken - and shares real bum insteadA body-positive Instagram star has been praised for her refreshing honesty, debunking how influencers taking the perfect bikini and highlighting how social media isnt always realityHayley has a very important message to share with followersByJulia BanimAudience WriterSamantha BartlettSenior Lestyle  Travel Reporter:,  Mar |comments As much as we might try and remind ourselves that social media isnapost reflective of reality, knowing full well that we shouldnapost beat ourselves up for falling short of aposperfectionapos, is easier said than done at times.So itaposs always good when a bonafide influencer comes forward to lt the curtain on what actually goes into getting those impossibly aposperfectapos shots, reminding you that what you see in the bathroom mirror is just as beautul.As previously reported by theDaily Star,personal trainer Hayley Madigan - who champions all things reality, health, body confidence and fitness - has now come forward to expose the truth on how certain influencers get their butt looking a certain way, using her own bottom as an example. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here.Using side-by-side pics, Hayley - who goes by the username @ hayleymadiganfitness - showed the dference between an Insta Pool Pose Vs What I see in the bathroom mirror, showing a posed pic next to what her bum looks like in reality.In a powerful caption, Hayley explained: Dferent poses, dferent camera angles, dferent posture, dferent lighting can all make a huge dference to how a body is perceived and more specically how you see your own body! You will see your body in all types of angles and poses. You will see your body relaxed and unposed. You will see yourself in many ways so do not let your eyes deceive you by telling you to feel negative towards your own body.  She continued: You have the power to change your mindset, to look at your own body in a kinder manner. To be kinder to yourself and to your mental health. To be kinder to your body, because it is your home and you only have one so treat it with the best kindness you can offer! We often pick holes in our bodies continuously but when you realise that no one worth having in your le wouldn’t ever pick those same holes about you is an important thing to remember. The people that care and love you do not see you the same way, all they see is the happiness, the love, and the sparkle that you bring to them and the world. You’re not just a body, you are YOU, so be kinder to yourself. Many people have been greatly touched by Hayleyaposs wise words, which are so very important in an age where le filtered through a social media lens can seriously impact the way we view our bodies.One person thanked Hayley for bringing some honesty to Instagram, really admire you for this, while another described her honesty as inspiring.A third person remarked that they wished such pics were shown in high schools, adding: I speak for myself around that age, I only saw the ‘perfect’ Instagram bodies. It’s easy to lose track of what is picture-perfect and what is real. I’d rather see everyday-perfect than picture-perfect more. Because we are perfect in our own way: every. single. one. of. us.Do you have a body positivity story to share  We pay for stories. news weird-news i-thought-guy-dating-sweet-"TikToker put off by dates comments about her sex leByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Mar |comments A woman was shocked after going on a date with a apossweetapos guy - as he implied she was an easy goer because she had children. Sharing her story on TikTok, Sammie Morrissey, , said that the man at first came across very well, offering to pay for food and going the extra mile to impress.But soon his demeanour changed, and he started getting rude with waiting staff - something that Sammie now recognises as a red flag. Then one day, after a date, he made a comment about her children that completely ruined the atmosphere, and now sheaposs describing the experience as one of the worse dates sheaposs been on. What do you think of the manaposs behaviour  Let us know in the comments... Sharing her story on TikTok, where she uploads as @sammiemorrissey, Sammie said: He seemed like a really sweet guy, he was very funny, he really laid it on thick the nice guy act.The second we sat down at the table, I started to get weird a*****e vibes. Sammie said that he got annoyed at waiters and complained about the restaurant, and she said: I was just really turned off by that, he had this weird negative energy about him and I didnapost really like that. I offered to pay. He would not let me do it which was nice of him.  Then, things went from bad to worse when they left the diner when she refused to go back to his place. She claims the man said: Look weaposre both adults here. I know that youaposre not exactly a virgin. You have a kid. That was enough for Sammie and she put an end to their romance and shared the story on TikTok for others to enjoy. She said: Man, he really got me enough on that first coffee date to meet him for dinner. Iaposve officially been on  first dates in the past two years.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. Sammieaposs video had over , views alongside hundreds of comments. One said: Yeah that’s sad. I’m glad you are okay. Then another wrote: The aposnice guysapos are usually the ones you have to watch out for. A lot of the times they’ve learned what they think we want to hear. And a third wrote: I’m glad that you have boundaries you know what you want and what you deserve. Iaposm happy that you are safe. title: lottery expert shares top tips
story: Lottery expert shares top tips to win big - and why you havent won jackpot yetExperts Yourlottoservice have revealed where you could be going wrong when you pick out your numbers for the lottery in hopes of winning the jackpot, including some tricks to increase your chancesA lottery expert has shared their top tips on winning big Image: Getty Images iStockphotoByJohn BettAudience WriterKit Roberts:,  Mar |comments A lottery expert has shared their top tips to win big and revealed why you havenapost won the jackpot yet.Many people would enjoy a big payout from the lottery, and with the cost of living increasing, thereaposs never been a better time to have some surplus cash.Maybe youaposve won a tenner here or there, or even walked away with a cool £, but very few people have ever won big money on the prize draws, as the Daily Star reports.Now, experts from Yourlottoservice have given out some tips and tricks that could increase your odds when youaposre next marking out the magic numbers. What do you think about the expert advice  Let us know in the comments...There could also be some errors that people make which actually make it even less likely that they will win any prizes. Here are some of the common lottery mistakes that could be sabotaging your chances of a big win... Playing less often As God told the desperate person praying to win the lottery, meet me halfway on this, buy a ticket. It doesnapost take a genius to work out thatyou buy more lottery tickets you will be more likely to win. Missing the weekly draw will decrease the already very long odds.  Playing alone However, buying more tickets can be very expensive, meaning that you could be forking out a lotyou want to buy multiple tickets. Playing in groups is a common way for people to buy more tickets, with groups of friends, families, and even work colleagues chipping in. Whilst you would share your prize, it does increase your chances of hitting a big prizeyou can have more tickets. One way to do this is to join a lottery syndicate, which is a group of people who play together on the understanding that they share any winnings. This ensures that you can play every week and maximise your chances of winning.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. Picking too many odd or even numbers While the lottery is chance, it is possible to look at what combinations of numbers come up most often and make your choices accordingly. For example, around % of Euromillions draws will have one of a few combinations of numbers. These include three odd and two even, or two odd and three even. Conversely, picking a majority of odd or even numbers puts a ticket in the smaller group of draws. title: mum 41 who looks 15
story: Mum, , who looks  years younger shares tricks for age-defying looksMum Amber Lancaster recently left her TikTok and Instagram followers baffled when she revealed her true age - with many believing she was at least  years younger Image: instagram amberlancasterByEmma RosemurgeyAudience WriterSophie FosterLestyle  Travel Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments A mum, who looks more than  years younger than her real age, has revealed the secret to her youthful appearance. Amber Lancaster, from Calornia, might be , but sheaposs regularly mistaken for a -year-old while posting beauty, fashion and lestyle content to her , Instagram followers. The LA influencer, who also boasts an impressive following on TikTok, regularly shares funny videos and stylish outfits on the app. However, a recent clip has left her followers baffled, after she revealed her true age, with any convinced it canapost be true, the Daily Star reports.This is for everyone who looks younger than their actual age and people donapost believe them when you tell them how old you are, the voice over in the clip said.Amber, explained in the caption that she was born in  making her over -years-old – and people in the comments couldn’t get over the information. One poster said:  going on , you look like a young lady on stage! People saying you look . I am . You look  – so beautul, a follower commented, while another added: Literally the only one I’ve seen where you actually look younger than your age. Now tell us all your secrets.” You look amazing !!! Give me your skincare, another commented, while hundreds more demanded to know her secrets.In another clip on her TikTok channel, @amberlancaster, the influencer obliged her fans and shared her ultimate anti-ageing secret in a video titled: Four skincare products I love and swear by.She said: First being tretinoin, you need a prescription for this, Iaposve been using it for  years and it’s literally changed my skin. Iaposm  years old and I credit this little tube right here. It stimulated collagen production, it’s like the number one ingredient that’s scientically proven to change your skin. But you do need a prescription for that. Amber also recommends adding a vitamin C serum to brighten the skin and the aposPonds Dry Skin facial Moisturiserapos at night.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: my parents gifted 24k wedding
story: My parents gted £k to my wedding  in-laws only gave £ - theyre so cheapA bride-to-be is being slammed online after moaning about her in-laws not contributing enough money to their wedding, after her own parents gted £, Image: Getty ImagesByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsWeddings are expensive - thereaposs no two ways about it. But, who should be expected to pay for a wedding is an entirely dferent debate. Nowadays, most couples tend to pay for their big day themselves, possibly with a little help from family, but back in the day, the tradition was for the brideaposs parents to shoulder most of the cost.However, one bride-to-be has been gaining a lot of negative attention online, after complaining that her future in-laws hadnapost contributed enough to her wedding. The brideaposs parents gted her an incredibly generous £,when they first announced their engagement, while her fianceeaposs parents - who are orced - gave £each. My parents graciously gave me £,as an engagement gt to start planning my wedding. My brother got married last year and received the same, she wrote anonymously in a Facebook group.My fianceaposs parents, who are orced, gave us £each at the engagement. Despite our wedding planning talk they made no voice of a contribution, so my fiance had to ask them directlythey were considering gting money just so we could factor in budgeting. They have come back with  . I know thataposs not nothing but I feel a tad hard done by. I understand everyone is in dferent circumstances but I feel sorry for my fiancee because there is such a large discrepancy. The bride concluded by saying her parents worked hard to set aside a wedding and education fund for herself and her siblings while they were younger, while his parents are currently spending money on holidays instead of his wedding.The post was later shared to Redditaposs Wedding Shaming forum, where people were less than impressed with the womanaposs greed.Iaposve read this a few times and Iaposm still gobsmacked by it. Is your partner   His parents raised him, he is an adult. If his parents want to spend their golden years enjoying le after raising a child for most of their adult le, I think absolutely good on them, one person wrote. If my partner had the same entitled attitudes I wouldnapost be planning a wedding, Iaposll say that much.Another added: Is this a joke  Seriously  I would rather my parents spend £, on a holiday than on my wedding any day! The people who are hard done by are those who canapost afford a wedding at all, those whose parents have died and will never be at their wedding, couples who have their wedding cancelled, people who have lost everything in floods or fire … shall I go on If youaposre genuinely asking for an opinion on this- I think you sound ungrateful and spoiled.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it.
